skill.name: create-pr
skill.description: Create pull requests following Sentry conventions. Use when opening PRs, writing PR descriptions, or preparing changes for review. Follows Sentry's code review guidelines.
skill.summary: Create pull requests following Sentry conventions. Use when opening PRs, writing PR descriptions, or...
skill.author: getsentry

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions for creating pull requests. No executable code, scripts, or potentially dangerous capabilities are present. The skill provides safe git/GitHub CLI guidance.

content.user_title: Create pull requests with Sentry conventions
content.value_statement: This skill guides you through creating GitHub pull requests following Sentry engineering practices. It provides step-by-step instructions for branch verification, change analysis, and PR description writing.
actual_capabilities: Verifies branch state and remote status
Analyzes commits and changes for PR scope
Formats PR titles using conventional commits
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be pre-installed and authenticated
Does not create branches or commit changes
Cannot modify existing PRs after creation
Does not support GitHub alternatives (GitLab, Bitbucket)

use_cases.title: Submit changes to repositories
use_cases.description: Create well-formatted pull requests following project conventions for faster review acceptance.

use_cases.title: Maintain consistent PR standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow the same PR structure and description format.

use_cases.title: Improve review efficiency
use_cases.description: Generate PRs with clear descriptions that reduce back-and-forth and speed up reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the create-pr skill to create a pull request for my current branch

prompt_templates.title: PR with reviewers
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR and add @username1 and @username2 as reviewers

prompt_templates.title: Feature PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR for my feature branch with a description explaining the new functionality

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR for a bug fix that references issue SENTRY-1234 in the description

best_practices: Run the commit skill first to ensure all changes are committed before creating a PR
Keep PRs small and focused on a single feature or fix
Explain the 'why' behind changes in the description, not just the 'what'
anti_patterns: Bundling unrelated changes in a single PR
Leaving PR descriptions empty or with just a title

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI (gh) must be installed and authenticated. Run 'gh auth login' first.

faq.question: Does this skill create branches?
faq.answer: No, this skill only creates pull requests. Use the commit skill to commit changes first.

faq.question: Can I use this with GitLab or Bitbucket?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed for GitHub only using the gh CLI tool.

faq.question: Is my data safe when creating PRs?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only reads git status and creates PRs via authenticated gh CLI.

faq.question: What if my branch is behind main?
faq.answer: Rebase your branch on main first. The skill checks for this during verification.

faq.question: How is this different from gh pr create directly?
faq.answer: This skill adds Sentry conventions, structured descriptions, and reviewer guidance.
